title: Finance Senior Manager / Vice President
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. KKR first established its presence in Asia Pacific in 2005. Since then, KKR has grown to more than US$50 billion of AUM across its strategies in the region, which include private equity, infrastructure, real estate, credit, impact, and growth technology – with approximately US$20 billion deployed in the recent three years alone. KKR has approximately 300 executives working across business functions and asset classes with offices located in Beijing, Hong Kong, Mumbai, Seoul, Shanghai, Singapore, Sydney, and Tokyo.
For additional information about KKR & Co. Inc.(NYSE: KKR), please visit KKR’s website at www.kkr.com.
TEAM OVERVIEW
KKR’s Global Finance team oversees the firm’s tax compliance, credit and accounting, and reporting matters to produce analytical insights that drive business decisions and long-term success. The team is responsible for designing efficient frameworks through internal and external data and reports to understand the market environment and business dynamics and implement best practices. The team also collaborates closely with KKR’s Legal and Compliance team to ensure compliance and accurate reporting and performance of our corporate tax entities related to our investment funds. The Global Finance team also functions as a support for clients, from onboarding to investor communications and overall relationship management across all asset class, as well as responding to any ad-hoc tax-related requests.
POSITION SUMMARY

Financial reporting under IND AS and US GAAP.
Cash flow management. Maintain internal financial controls and perform variance analysis.
Interface with auditors.
Approval and payment processing.
Manage direct and indirect tax.
Manage / oversee delivery from outsourced service provider.
Timely regulatory reporting.
MIS preparation.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Accurate and timely preparation and submission of financial reports.
Ensure internal financial controls are maintained, standard operating procedures are followed, and ongoing adherence with corporate policies.
Compliance with direct and indirect tax requirements.
Manage accounts payable and ensure timely payments to vendors.
Liquidity management including deployment of surplus cash into approved schemes.
Maintain relationships with banks.
Maintain control over Fixed Assets and proper depreciation.
Work closely with regional and global finance teams for monthly, quarterly, and annual financial and tax reporting.
Maintain the privacy of financial information.

QUALIFICATIONS 

Minimum 7 years’ related experience in Finance/Corporate Accounting
Excellent verbal, written, and visual communication skills.
Thorough understanding of accounting and tax.
Excellent time-management and organizational skills.
Problem solver and critical thinker mind-set.
Ability to roll up sleeves and be hands-on.
Excellent MS Office skills.
Prior NBFC and Financial Service experience will be an advantage
